segments.text: I glance at the kitchen and spot the overflowing sink right away.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Water is pouring out like a waterfall onto the floor.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman is right there, polishing her plate, oblivious to it all.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Her dress and apron look so neat, but that puddle is at her feet.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's going to ruin the cabinets and make everything slippery.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Over on the other side, the boy is on that stool, raiding the cookie jar.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The cabinet doors are wide open, framing him like a little thief.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: He looks determined, one hand full of cookies probably.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl beside him has her arm up, clearly wanting in on it.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: They think they're so clever, getting away with this.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The garden outside the window is calm, a nice contrast.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: But inside, it's a disaster waiting to unfold.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel bad for the mess that's about to get worse.
segments.speaker: PAR
